x 56 in inch es k knit m1 make one by picking up loop between last and equipment next stitch and work into the back of this loop mm millimetres one pair of 5mm uk6/us8 knitting needles p purl one 5mm uk6/us8 circular knitting needle 100cm long patt pattern one pair of 4mm uk8/us6 knitting needles repeat repeat one 4mm uk8/us6 circular knitting needle 100cm long rs right side sl1 slip 1 stitch knitwise picking up large amounts of stitches st s stitch es for blanket border st-st stocking stitch 1 row knit 1 row purl to make picking up large amounts of sts easier fold the when working in row first edge to be picked up in half and place marker at fold decrease together next fold the remaining sides in half and place markers at ws wrong side each fold divide the pick-up sts into four equal stitch counts pick up these sts between the markers yarn gauge west yorkshire spinners the croft aran 18 sts and 24 row to 10cm 4in over stocking stitch pattern using 5mm needles or size required to give correct gauge a stanydale 1011 6 x 100g if there are less sts to 10cm than the number stated change to a smaller needle if there are more sts to 10cm than the number stated change to a larger needle b reawick 1010 4 x 100g it is essential to work to the stated gauge to ensure success c sullom 010 5 x 100g working from a chart when working from a chart you will read all rs row from right to left and all ws row from left to right fair isle and intarsia techniques when working with two or three colours at once the colours not in use should be stranded loosely across the back of colour
